content: Yes, I do have data on how much revenue UC Berkeley generates for the local economy. According to a report by the Bay Area Council Economic Institute, UC Berkeley contributes approximately $9.8 billion annually to the Bay Area economy, with $4.2 billion of that directly benefiting the local economy in Berkeley. The university also supports over 80,000 jobs in the Bay Area, including both direct employment on campus and indirect employment in the surrounding community. Additionally, the report estimates that for every dollar spent by UC Berkeley, an additional $1.50 is generated for the local economy through multiplier effects.
